rev.comment: Pipe some external reference links so they don't force the page to scroll horizontally
/* Demographics in the late Ottoman and British Mandate periods */
How this slipped out I don't know. Porath 'questioned' in great detail Pipes' remarks, and thus the text as it stood was misleading
Date/fix the maintenance tags or gen fixes using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
Just for consistency. Removed periods from BCE and CE in the few cases where they were used.
BOT - Reverted edits by [[Special:contributions/68.18.25.28|68.18.25.28]] {[[User:VoABot_II/Help#Revert_reasons|possible vandalism]]} to revision #173557179 by "Nishidani".
The problem here was simply one of tense. The Mandate sense is no longer current.
Initially it was. Only after Aabdallah and his Bedouins from Arabia captured the present day Jordan it was removed from the British mandate.
Jordan was not part of British Mandate Palestine, it was administered under a separate mandate for the Transjordan

/* Byzantine (Eastern Roman Empire) rule (330-640 CE) */ Repairing link to disambiguation page - [[Wikipedia:Disambiguation pages with links|You can help!]]
"Cisjordan" only refers to Western Palestine (west of the Jordan River), and is not an English name for Palestine as a whole.
The Hebrew equivalent of "Palestine" is "ארץ־ישראל". In the 19th century and early 20th century, "פלשתינה" was also sometimes used.
/* Traveller's impressions of Nineteenth Century Palestine */
